decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back to the battlefield using reanimation spells like Unearth and Persist. The creatures in this deck, such as Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, have strong abilities that can quickly turn the tide of the game in your favor. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Spell Pierce to control the game and protect your combo. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful reanimated creatures and take control of the game.

The deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with targeted removal and countermagic. It aims to play efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to apply pressure, while also using spells like Prismatic Ending and Galvanic Discharge to control the board. The deck also utilizes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Consign to Memory for card advantage and disruption. Overall, the strategy involves being proactive in attacking the opponent's resources while maintaining a solid board presence.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the opponent's resources and close out the game quickly. By utilizing cards like Quantum Riddler and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to apply pressure, along with removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory to disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent. Additionally, the deck features efficient card draw and card advantage options like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Meticulous Archive to maintain tempo and stay ahead in the game.

This deck focuses on using Ruby Storm cards to generate mana quickly and efficiently, allowing the player to cast multiple spells in a single turn. The key strategy is to use cards like Manamorphose, Pyretic Ritual, and Desperate Ritual to ramp up mana, while also utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible to draw cards and find combo pieces. Once enough mana is generated, the player can use cards like Past in Flames and Grapeshot to either cast spells from the graveyard or finish off the opponent with a large burn spell.

This combo deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus Rider and Nourishing Shoal combo to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. The deck utilizes cards like Neoform, Eldritch Evolution, and Summoner's Pact to tutor for key pieces and create a fast, explosive win condition. Veil of Summer and Pact of Negation provide protection, while Misty Rainforest and other fetchlands help with mana fixing. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big creatures and efficient combo plays, backed up by disruption and card advantage options like Endurance and Consign to Memory.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, backed up by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and versatile spells like Thraben Charm to control the board and push for lethal damage. With a mix of creatures, burn, and control elements, this deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain a strong board presence to secure a quick victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck aims to control the game by ramping up mana quickly with Eldrazi ramp cards like Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl. The deck focuses on playing big Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to dominate the board. It also includes powerful control cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Kozilek's Return to deal with threats. The deck's strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with giant creatures and powerful spells while disrupting their game plan with removal and control elements.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value through cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also includes a mix of burn spells and card draw to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. Overall, the key concept of this UR Control deck is to use a combination of counterspells and removal to control the game and outmaneuver the opponent's threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ultimately win through powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi. The deck aims to control the game by countering key spells, removing threats, and locking down the opponent's resources. The inclusion of Isochron Scepter and other synergy cards provide additional value and flexibility in managing the board state. With access to a variety of control tools and finishers, this deck looks to outsmart and outmaneuver opponents in a strategic battle of wits.

Utilize Urza's Tower, Mine, and Power Plant to assemble Tron, allowing for ramp and powerful plays. Utilize control elements like Disruptor Flute and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. Finish the game with massive Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End, backed up by All Is Dust for board wipes. The deck combines efficient removal, disruption, and massive threats to dominate the late game and overwhelm opponents.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures with disruptive elements to control the game and prevent opponents from executing their game plan effectively. Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide powerful threats, while Quantum Riddler and Consign to Memory disrupt opponents' strategies. Ephemerate and Prismatic Ending offer versatile removal options, while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Arena of Glory provide additional disruption and card advantage. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's aggressive strategy while ensuring consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on low-cost aggressive creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Bloodghast and Lightning Skelemental to put pressure on the opponent early on, backed up by efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat. The deck aims to maintain a steady stream of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Leyline of Combustion. By applying constant pressure and utilizing graveyard recursion, the deck seeks to close out games swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with key combo pieces, such as Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, and then reanimate them using cards like Persist, Unearth, and Gran-Gran to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. By utilizing cards like Thought Scour and Faithless Looting, the deck can efficiently cycle through the deck to find the necessary pieces for its game-winning combos. The deck seeks to outpace the opponent by leveraging graveyard recursion and powerful creatures to create a dominant board state and secure victory.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, supported by direct damage effects like Goblin Bombardment and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence while controlling the opponent's resources with cards like Thraben Charm and Blood Moon. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provides additional card advantage and versatility to adapt to different matchups. Overall, the strategy revolves around fast-paced aggression and efficient card selection to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to establish board presence early on using creatures like Ragavan and Guide of Souls, backed up by removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge. Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Goblin Bombardment provide additional value and reach. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional support and finishers to help seal the game in the player's favor.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay with a mix of creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply pressure early on, while cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Galvanic Discharge provide additional reach and removal. The inclusion of cards like Arena of Glory and Goblin Bombardment offer additional ways to deal with opponent's threats and maintain a strong board presence. Additionally, the mana base includes fetch lands and utility lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in gameplay.
